stadium.name: The Sinking Field
stadium.description: A notoriously poorly-maintained stadium built on reclaimed marshland. The ground is unstable, often waterlogged, and sections of the stands are known to collapse.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Daring a teammate to eat a live worm.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Tapping each piece of their armor in a specific sequence.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.

Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.

Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.

stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è PLAYOFF HYPE: MUD, BLOOD, AND GLORY AT THE SINKING FIELD! üéôÔ∏è

Hello, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the sludge-filled glory of the Sinking Field! Pull up a chair and pour yourself a glass of something that'll melt your teeth, because it's playoff time in the Losers Bracket! We are kicking off Game 1 of a Best of 3 series, and the air is thick‚Äîpartly with tension, and mostly with the noxious fumes rising from the unstable turf! It's a real treat for the senses, I tell you! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ

The home crowd is... well, they're here! Maybe not in droves, but what they lack in numbers, they make up for in sheer, unadulterated gloom! My favorite bunch of miscreants, the Ebon Gate Corruptors, are looking to send those Wyrmwood Stronghammers back to the tower in pieces! The Stronghammers are looking focused, though I suspect Ultun Barthelemy is more focused on braiding his teammate's nose hair than the ball! Truly, the pre-game rituals in this league are a testament to the mental fortitude‚Äîor lack thereof‚Äîof our players! üëÉü™Æ

Speaking of rituals, I caught Kerwin Gasper asking the referee to bless their Kriegsmesser! Can you believe it? In this economy? Meanwhile, our boys from the Ebon Gate were busy daring each other to eat live worms. That‚Äôs the kind of grit‚Äîand protein‚Äîthat wins championships! Keep an eye on the ground today, folks; if the thick mud doesn't swallow you, the sinkholes surely will! Let‚Äôs get ready for some Trollball! ü™±üí•
postGame:
# üèüÔ∏è POST-GAME WRAP-UP: A MUDDY HEARTBREAKER! üèüÔ∏è

Holy smokes, what a way to start the series! The Sinking Field certainly lived up to its name today, swallowing cleats and dignity alike! It was a bone-rattling, mud-caked affair that saw the Wyrmwood Stronghammers sneak away with a 3-2 victory in this opening playoff tilt! The atmosphere was as heavy as Sir Tanos' conscience after a night of stabbing people who can't read! üèüÔ∏èüå™Ô∏è

The action started fast and furious! Godart Urissa, wearing that ridiculously oversized floppy hat, scooped up the troll head in center field like a hungry wolf! Before the Corruptors could even wipe the noxious fumes from their eyes, Kerwin Gasper stepped up and absolutely nailed a long-distance shot! Two points on the board before the mud could even settle! Talk about a start! üéØüî•

Our Corruptors tried to fight back, but the tackling was a bit shaky early on! Amedeo Bari and Smith Syst were swinging at shadows! Meanwhile, Autumn Jodoin was chugging raw eggs and running like a possessed stag, charging straight into the end zone for a dunk! That put the Stronghammers up by three, and I tell you, my dark heart was sinking faster than a spectator in the West Stand! ü•öüí®

But then came the violence! Oh, the beautiful, crunchy violence! Olnek Vizzone finally found his footing and absolutely leveled Sabian Gleason! The sound of that impact was better than any sea shanty Judi Carrington could ever sing! Sabian went down hard, and the medical staff had to wade through the thick mud to drag him off! üëäü©∏

Ahasuerus An was a one-woman wrecking crew for the Corruptors! She tackled Sondra Elaina and Ultun Barthelemy into next Tuesday! It was a display of defensive prowess that would make even Morgwae blush, though he‚Äôs too busy being 'exiled' to appreciate real talent! The field was practically littered with Stronghammers by the time the halftime whistle blew! ‚öîÔ∏èü¶¥

Halftime saw everyone patched up by the healers, including Hamburger Marthe, who I assume stopped sticking beans in his nose long enough to work some magic. When the second half started, the Corruptors came out swinging! Judi Carrington sent Calvinna Isador to the dirt with a tackle that surely rattled her ancestors! üè•ü©∫

The comeback was on! Amedeo Bari found an opening and dunked that troll head with the grace of a falling anvil! The Sinking Field erupted‚Äîor maybe that was just a gas pocket bursting! Either way, it was 3-1! The momentum was shifting, and you could feel the desperation in the Wyrmwood ranks! üèÄüëπ

Simsar Carrelli kept the fire burning! After some fancy passing play, he charged through the mud and slammed another dunk home! 3-2! It was a one-point game, and I was screaming loud enough to wake Lord Orzalon from his prison nap! The Corruptors were clawing their way back, showing that 'never-say-die' attitude that makes them the best in the realm! üìàüôå

The final minutes were pure chaos! Odelia Abbott and Simsar Carrelli were trading blows, with Ellette Paz and Cornela Piscatelli both being carted off the field with fresh injuries! The mud was getting deeper, the fumes were getting thicker, and Napoleon Anzovin was looking to make a hero play! üå™Ô∏èü§ï

But alas, tragedy struck! Napoleon tried a wild pass, probably thinking he was as smooth as Falric the heart-thief, but it was intercepted by that hat-wearing Godart Urissa! That sealed the deal, folks. The Wyrmwood Stronghammers take Game 1 of this Best of 3 series. My Corruptors have their backs against the wall, but don't count them out yet! We‚Äôll be back for Game 2, hopefully with less mud in our ears! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ
